snippet: The group Physicians for Human Rights says that Bahraini police officers are firing tear gas not only into crowds of protesters but also into homes and vehicles in Shiite neighborhoods.
abstract: Physicians for Human Rights reports that Bahrain's ruling Sunni minority is engaged in systematic and disproportionate use of tear gas against its restive Shiite majority; police officers have routinely fired volleys at point-blank range at crowds and into homes in an attempt to tamp down protests inspired by the Arab Spring uprisings.
lead_paragraph: The group Physicians for Human Rights says that Bahraini police officers are firing tear gas not only into crowds of protesters but also into homes and vehicles in Shiite neighborhoods.

headline.seo: Bahrain Criticized for ‘Torrent’ of Tear Gas Use
headline.main: Bahrain Is Criticized for Its ‘Torrent’ of Tear Gas Use
headline.print_headline: Bahrain Is Criticized for Its ‘Torrent’ of Tear Gas Use
